article.title: New representations for square-integrable spheroidal functions

choices: ...the domain of the original Schrödinger equation.
...the singular points for the spheroidal equation on the real axis.
...the range of the variable \'t\' and singular points after the substitution.
...the relationship between Cartesian and oblate spheroidal coordinates.

multiple_choice_question.text: The generalized Jaffe transformation aims to...
choices: ...express the eigenfunction as a single power series.
...map the singular points to a straight line for easier computation.
...transform the domain of the variable to facilitate series representation.
...directly solve the boundary value problem without using series expansions.
...the solution for eigenfunctions in terms of power series.
...the five-term recurrence relations between coefficients of the series.
...the condition for smooth matching of solutions at the boundary.
...the energy levels of a quantum ring with a potential well.
...the probability density distribution of a particle in a spheroidal well.
...the geometrical shape of a quantum ring in oblate spheroidal coordinates.
...the eigenfunctions of the Schrödinger equation for a spheroidal potential.
